title: [DOC-FIX] Error: No such option: --artifacts-destination-root

labels.name: has-closing-pr
labels.description: This issue has a closing PR

body:
### Willingness to contribute

No. I cannot contribute a documentation fix at this time.

### URL(s) with the issue

https://www.mlflow.org/docs/latest/tracking.html#scenario-5-mlflow-tracking-server-enabled-with-proxied-artifact-storage-access
https://www.mlflow.org/docs/latest/cli.html#mlflow-server

### Description of proposal (what needs changing)

Following the instructions (on https://www.mlflow.org/docs/latest/tracking.html#scenario-5-mlflow-tracking-server-enabled-with-proxied-artifact-storage-access):
> Command to run the tracking server in this configuration 
> ```
> mlflow server \
>   --backend-store-uri postgresql://user:password@postgres:5432/mlflowdb \
>   # Artifact access is enabled through the proxy URI 'mlflow-artifacts:/',
>   # giving users access to this location without having to manage credentials
>   # or permissions.
>   --artifact-destination-root s3://bucket_name \
>   --host remote_host
> ```

Results in the error
> `Error: No such option: --artifacts-destination-root (Possible options: --artifacts-destination, --artifacts-only) mlflow exited with code 2`

The documentation of the CLI (https://www.mlflow.org/docs/latest/cli.html#mlflow-server) does not specify this option, so the error seems justified.

The instructions thus need updating to work with the current commands (instructions on https://www.mlflow.org/docs/latest/tracking.html#scenario-5-mlflow-tracking-server-enabled-with-proxied-artifact-storage-access).
